content:
• Wednesday, January 18, 2012
  • FSII

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII) gains in the post session after announcing it's received...

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII) gains in the post session after announcing it's received follow-on orders for its Antares CryoKinetic Cleaning System from a leading semiconductor manufacturer. Shares +2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:36 PM
  • WBMD

    WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) rises 2.3% AH after Carl Icahn files a 13-D disclosing he's increased his...

    WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) rises 2.3% AH after Carl Icahn files a 13-D disclosing he's increased his stake in the company to 11.64%. In the filing, Icahn calls on WebMD to repurchase up to 1B shares through a Dutch tender offer with a maximum price of $30/share. In November, Icahn floated a similar proposal involving a $36/share maximum. But that was before WebMD issued its massive warning.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM
  • TPX

    More on Sealy (ZZ): Q4 misses the mark badly as losses widened on weaker sales and margins. The...

    More on Sealy (ZZ): Q4 misses the mark badly as losses widened on weaker sales and margins. The company had seen sales improve over recent quarters due to investments in its product line and a new advertising campaign, but warned in September that a weak consumer environment and raw material inflation was significantly hampering gross margin expansion in the second half. Shares -13.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM
  • BKU

    BankUnited (NYSE:BKU) decides not to proceed with a possible sale of the company, and will...

    BankUnited (NYSE:BKU) decides not to proceed with a possible sale of the company, and will “continue to pursue its original plan to build the premier bank throughout Florida as an independent institution." BKU -10.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • WINA

    Retail franchise owner Winmark (NASDAQ:WINA) rises 1.3% AH after declaring a $5/share special...

    Retail franchise owner Winmark (NASDAQ:WINA) rises 1.3% AH after declaring a $5/share special dividend, payable on March 1 to shareholders on record as of Feb. 8. The company says it will "use a combination of cash on hand as well as bank borrowings to finance the special dividend."

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • FUL

    H. B. Fuller (NYSE:FUL): Q4 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $436.5M (+21% Y/Y) beats by...

    H. B. Fuller (NYSE:FUL): Q4 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $436.5M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $18M. Shares +3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • XLNX

    Thanks to Xilinx's (NASDAQ:XLNX) FQ3 beat and strong FQ4 guidance, shares of archrival Altera...

    Thanks to Xilinx's (NASDAQ:XLNX) FQ3 beat and strong FQ4 guidance, shares of archrival Altera (ALTR +9.9%), which soared along with many other chip names (SOXX +5.1%) in regular trading, are up 4.9% AH. Also rising AH: LSCC +7%. MXIM +1.9%. BRCM +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • ALB

    Albemarle Corp (NYSE:ALB) says it intends to separate its electronic-grade metal organics into a...

    Albemarle Corp (NYSE:ALB) says it intends to separate its electronic-grade metal organics into a new electronic materials business unit, which will operate as a subgroup of its newly renamed Performance Catalyst Solutions division. The newly-formed unit will serve its rapidly expanding LED, compound semiconductor and solar panel business. Shares -1.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • EGHT

    More on 8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT): Q3 earnings beat estimates on a 31% jump in revenue compared to the...

    More on 8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT): Q3 earnings beat estimates on a 31% jump in revenue compared to the same period last year and a 17% sequential increase from the prior quarter. Business customer churn decreased to a record low of 2.0%. The Company ended the quarter with 27,677 business customers, with the average new customer purchasing 14.1 services. Shares +8.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • NVEC

    More on NVE (NASDAQ:NVEC): FQ3 earnings miss on 23% Y/Y decline in profit due to a 19% decrease...

    More on NVE (NASDAQ:NVEC): FQ3 earnings miss on 23% Y/Y decline in profit due to a 19% decrease in product sales and a 40% drop in contract R&D revenue over the same period last year. Shares -4.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • FRAN

    Women's apparel retailer Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) drops 5.2% AH, to $21.81, after...

    Women's apparel retailer Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) drops 5.2% AH, to $21.81, after filing to sell 9M shares held by insiders at a maximum offering price of $22.21. Francesca's went public in July. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • PLXS

    More on Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS): FQ1 earnings match estimates on revenue but beat on a per share...

    More on Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS): FQ1 earnings match estimates on revenue but beat on a per share basis, as strength in its engineering business helped offset lower overall sales. The company also guides its FQ2 higher, now expecting to earn between $0.51 - $0.58 per share on revenue of around $550M - $580M. Street estimates are for an EPS of $0.51 on revenue of $548M. Shares +9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • XLNX

    More on Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): FQ3 beats estimates in spite of an 8% sequential decine in sales,...

    More on Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): FQ3 beats estimates in spite of an 8% sequential decine in sales, boosted by improved cash flows and better gross margin. The company also guides FQ4 revenue higher, now expecting to earn between $521M to $541M. Street estimates are for $511M. Shares +7.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tanker (NYSE:NAT) announces an underwritten offering of 5.5M shares of its...

    Nordic American Tanker (NYSE:NAT) announces an underwritten offering of 5.5M shares of its common shares that the tanker company says it will use to fund future acquisitions and for general corporate purposes. Shares -5.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • FFIV

    More on F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ1 beats estimates across the board on a 19% Y/Y jump in...

    More on F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ1 beats estimates across the board on a 19% Y/Y jump in revenue, boosted by strong global sales in its Viprion product line, particularly North America. The company also guides FQ2 higher, saying EPS will be around $1.05 - $1.07 on revenue of between $332M - $337M. Street estimates are for earnings of $1.05 per share on $331M in revenue. Shares +5.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • SANM

    Sanmina-SCI (NASDAQ:SANM):  FQ1 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $1.5B (-10% Y/Y)...

    Sanmina-SCI (NASDAQ:SANM):  FQ1 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $1.5B (-10% Y/Y) misses by $60M. Expects FQ2 revenue of $1.45B-$1.55B, compared with $1.53B consensus. Expects FQ2 EPS of $0.24-$0.30, below $0.31 consensus. Company says it will redeem up to $150M in 8.125% notes due 2016. Shares -9.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ1 EPS of $1.03 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $322.4M (+19.8% Y/Y)...

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ1 EPS of $1.03 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $322.4M (+19.8% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • EBAY

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q4 EPS of $0.60 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $3.4B (+35% Y/Y) beats by $0.2B....

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q4 EPS of $0.60 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $3.4B (+35% Y/Y) beats by $0.2B. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • RSH

    RadioShack (RSH +11.5%) goes on a tear, finishing near its highs after Barclays upped the stock...

    RadioShack (RSH +11.5%) goes on a tear, finishing near its highs after Barclays upped the stock to Equal Weight on valuation earlier today. The firm says the electronics retailer's fundamentals are stabilizing, and financial results will look good in 2012 when compared Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • WSM

    After a three-session, 15% stock slump following its FQ4 profit warning that pushed shares to a...

    After a three-session, 15% stock slump following its FQ4 profit warning that pushed shares to a three-month low, Williams-Sonoma (WSM +5.2%) moves higher on Raymond James' upgrade to Strong Buy. The firm, which sets a $40 price target, says WSM has "much less risk in the stock," adding it's at "a compelling entry point."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • LLTC

    Linear Technology (LLTC +11.9%) powers to the top of the S&P leader board after its strong...

    Linear Technology (LLTC +11.9%) powers to the top of the S&P leader board after its strong upward guidance, and CFO Paul Coghlan adds that it may have reached an “inflection point," with little growth expected to come from inventory replenishment. As “the first positive revision for a larger cap semiconductor stock in a while," peers also move up: TXN +8.7%, ADI +5.8%, XLNX +5.7%, ALTR +9.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • WRK

    MeadWestvaco (MWV -1.7%) drops after saying it expects weak demand to hurt Q4 results in some of...

    MeadWestvaco (MWV -1.7%) drops after saying it expects weak demand to hurt Q4 results in some of its U.S. and European packaging markets. It now expects Q4 income to be in the range of $150M - $160M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • EW

    Shares of Edwards Lifesciences (EW +6.9%) stage a late afternoon rally after Jefferies chimes in...

    Shares of Edwards Lifesciences (EW +6.9%) stage a late afternoon rally after Jefferies chimes in with positive comments. Analysts with the firm point to "favorable" clinical data from EW's Sapien heart valve implantation - saying that it sets up well for regulatory approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • MGM

    Casino stocks enjoy a boost after Credit Suisse raises its rating and price target on...

    Casino stocks enjoy a boost after Credit Suisse raises its rating and price target on MGM Resorts (MGM +3.9%), citing improvements on the Vegas strip and a possible dividend from the company's Macau segment. Most gaming stocks rose yesterday after Macau gaming revenue tallied another strong quarter. Today: LVS +1.1%, WYNN +4.3%, MPEL +1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • PNC

    PNC Financial Services (PNC -2.8%) trails the market after its Q4 EPS missed estimates earlier...

    PNC Financial Services (PNC -2.8%) trails the market after its Q4 EPS missed estimates earlier today. Profit slid 42% Y/Y as the lender continues to struggle with a decline in revenue and steep charges. One positive takeaway however, is that credit costs continue to fall. Loan loss provisions totaled $190M for the quarter, down significantly from $442M the year prior.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • OSIS

    Osi Systems (OSIS +6.5%) trades up after announcing that its security division received a...

    Osi Systems (OSIS +6.5%) trades up after announcing that its security division received a six-year agreement worth around $400M to provide cargo and vehicle security screening systems and inspection services throughout Mexico.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • LNG

    Confirming earlier chatter, BTIG initiates Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) with a Buy and a $19...

    Confirming earlier chatter, BTIG initiates Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) with a Buy and a $19 price target. BTIG believes 2012 will be "transformative" for Cheniere, with catalysts including securing new financing for its natgas export project and bringing that project to 100% baseline capacity. Shares +8.5% to $10.43. (submitted by Holly Thompson)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • PBH

    Generic drugmaker Prestige Brands (PBH +3.9%) is trading higher after disclosing its FQ3 revenue...

    Generic drugmaker Prestige Brands (PBH +3.9%) is trading higher after disclosing its FQ3 revenue rose 17% Y/Y, better than a 14.6% consensus. The company also claims its gross margin rose 16% Y/Y. Separately, Prestige is announcing a $290M debt offering; it partly plans to use the proceeds to finance its acquisition of 17 OTC drug brands from GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • AROC

    Exterran (EXH +8%) jumps after being selected by Pemex, Mexico's national oil and gas company,...

    Exterran (EXH +8%) jumps after being selected by Pemex, Mexico's national oil and gas company, to provide gas conditioning, treatment and compression systems in three of its natural gas facilities in Mexico.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • CCL

    Cruise line operators begin to claw back after Carnival's (CCL +2.4%) weekend tragedy sent its...

    Cruise line operators begin to claw back after Carnival's (CCL +2.4%) weekend tragedy sent its shares plunging 14% yesterday. Subsidiary Costa Crociere, operator of the ship that ran aground, makes up 16% of CCL's fleet, UBS estimates. Analysts lower estimates, though it will be a while before there's clarity on the financial impact of any loss of demand. Also, RCL +2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • SPXC

    SPX (SPW -3.75%) is up today, despite issuing 2012 guidance that fell short of analysts'...

    SPX (SPW -3.75%) is up today, despite issuing 2012 guidance that fell short of analysts' estimates. FY EPS range is now expected range between $4.70 - $5.10, below expectations for $5.20. The company blames the shortfall on expectations for a weak economic climate in the U.S. and Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • KODK

    Shares of Eastman Kodak (EK +11.7%) have swayed all day with on-again, off-again rumors of a...

    Shares of Eastman Kodak (EK +11.7%) have swayed all day with on-again, off-again rumors of a position taken out by David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital. While traders maintain Einhorn discussed EK at a corporate dinner last night, the firm's Q4 report held nary a word about the embattled tech firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • LNG

    Shares of Cheniere Energy (LNG +9.4%) take off midday after word spreads that BTIG is initiating...

    Shares of Cheniere Energy (LNG +9.4%) take off midday after word spreads that BTIG is initiating coverage with a Buy rating and lofty $19 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • CSH

    Cash America (CSH -7.5%) takes a hit after warning late yesterday that its 2011 EPS would be...

    Cash America (CSH -7.5%) takes a hit after warning late yesterday that its 2011 EPS would be short of the mark due to higher installment credit costs and narrower margins. Separately FBR cuts the shares to Market Perform on the news, saying it's going to take time for condiditons to bounce back to more normalized levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • TOL

    It's only January 18, but is it possible the 2012 housing rebound play is already getting a bit...

    It's only January 18, but is it possible the 2012 housing rebound play is already getting a bit crowded? The XHB +10.9%, TOL +14.3%, LEN +16.3%, HD +6.3% YTD. Even bigger winners are building materials firms, USG +42.5%, PATK +50% YTD. Arguing for an even bigger run is most of these stocks are higher off of very low bases.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • ARW

    IT hardware/chip distributors Arrow Electronics (ARW +6.7%) and Avnet (AVT +7%) are following...

    IT hardware/chip distributors Arrow Electronics (ARW +6.7%) and Avnet (AVT +7%) are following chip stocks higher (SOXX +4.3%) in the wake of Linear Technology's (LLTC +10.2%) strong FQ2 guidance. Also of interest for Arrow is the company's announcement that it's acquiring TechTurn, a provider of services for refurbishing and retiring used hardware. TechTurn is expected to produce $50M in 2012 sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • ADTN

    Telecom equipment maker Adtran (ADTN +6.8%) is surging after reporting Q4 revenue of $175.3M...

    Telecom equipment maker Adtran (ADTN +6.8%) is surging after reporting Q4 revenue of $175.3M (+6% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.48, beating consensus by $0.6M and $0.01. Strong growth in Broadband Access and Internetworking revenue offset declining legacy product sales. During its earnings call this morning, Adtran guided for flat Q/Q revenue growth (consensus if for a small increase).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • PWR

    Shares of Quanta Services (PWR -1.9%) take a tumble on word that the Obama administration will...

    Shares of Quanta Services (PWR -1.9%) take a tumble on word that the Obama administration will issue a no-go on the Keystone XL pipeline that was expected to bring in significant revenue for the firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • DMND

    Shares of embattled Diamond Foods (DMND +5.2%) pop after David Einhorn says he's no longer short...

    Shares of embattled Diamond Foods (DMND +5.2%) pop after David Einhorn says he's no longer short the company. Einhorn says his short position in the stock was "small" but one of the best-performing shorts in Greenlight Capital's history. (previous: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals continues to be volatile (QCOR -2.6%) ahead of a pending report from...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals continues to be volatile (QCOR -2.6%) ahead of a pending report from TheStreetSweeper attacking its marketing and business practices. After rebounding yesterday following the release of a PR responding to a series of questions presented by TheStreetSweeper, shares are selling off today after the site confirmed it will still publish a report.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • FSLR

    More from Einhorn (full letter here): First Solar (FSLR +5%) is rallying, helped by news...

    More from Einhorn (full letter here): First Solar (FSLR +5%) is rallying, helped by news Greenlight has covered its short (and the firm's biggest 2011 winner) after riding the stock down from $130 to $34. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • RRMS

    Rose Rock Midstream (RRMS +2.3%) gets a boost this morning from a slew of initiations, as Baird...

    Rose Rock Midstream (RRMS +2.3%) gets a boost this morning from a slew of initiations, as Baird starts it with an Outperform, Citgroup with a Buy and Barclays with an Overweight. Additionally, pipeline manager SemGroup also said late yesterday that it had taken a 16% stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    Greenlight Capital discloses a new position in Dell (DELL-OLD +2.4%) in a Q4 letter to clients,...

    Greenlight Capital discloses a new position in Dell (DELL-OLD +2.4%) in a Q4 letter to clients, with David Einhorn's firm saying it bought into Dell at an average price of $15.53. Sources say Xerox (XRX +2.2%) is also mentioned in the note.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • CY

    Cypress Semiconductor (CY +5.7%) rallies after announcing it has "reached an agreement" with...

    Cypress Semiconductor (CY +5.7%) rallies after announcing it has "reached an agreement" with Alcatel-Lucent that will put an end to the latter's involvement in lawsuit Cypress has filed against GSI Technology (NASDAQ:GSIT) over its alleged infringement of Cypress' SRAM chip patents. Last Friday, Cypress announced it was dropping a trade secret lawsuit against Maxim Integrated (NASDAQ:MXIM).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon's (AMZN +2.4%) Kindle Fire might be more profitable than expected, RBC Capital...

    Amazon's (AMZN +2.4%) Kindle Fire might be more profitable than expected, RBC Capital believes, seeing 3M-4M sales accretive to operating margins within the first six months of ownership. RBC's analysis assigns a cumulative lifetime operating income of $136/unit at a 20%-plus operating margin, which "could ease some investor concerns around operating margin compression."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • SKX

    Skechers (SKX -4.3%) takes a hit after being cut to Hold at BB&T Capital, saying its recent...

    Skechers (SKX -4.3%) takes a hit after being cut to Hold at BB&T Capital, saying its recent channel checks indicate a sales recovery in 2012 isn't likely.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • KRO

    Kronos Worldwide (KRO -3.5%) trades lower after Stephens downgrades the shares to Equalweight on...

    Kronos Worldwide (KRO -3.5%) trades lower after Stephens downgrades the shares to Equalweight on valuation, citing growing margin pressures.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • HOV

    Shares of home builders pop (XHB +2%) after the NAHB index rose for the fourth straight month to...

    Shares of home builders pop (XHB +2%) after the NAHB index rose for the fourth straight month to its highest level since June 2007: HOV +7.5%, PHM +4.4%, LEN +3.5%, TOL +2.9%, KBH +4.1%, BZH +5.1%. But BTIG's Dan Greenhaus reminds that the index is at 25, still very low, and many headwinds remain that "should prevent broad improvement."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • STT

    State Street (STT -7.1%) in a bad state following its earnings miss and after it said that would...

    State Street (STT -7.1%) in a bad state following its earnings miss and after it said that would make further cost cuts at its capital-markets ops due to what it expects to be continued weakenss in global markets. Shares are down despite operating profit rising 4.4% to $454M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • TXT

    Textron (TXT -1%) dips after JP Morgan cuts the shares to Neutral, saying the recovery at Cessna...

    Textron (TXT -1%) dips after JP Morgan cuts the shares to Neutral, saying the recovery at Cessna is taking longer than expected.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • EBAY

    Repeating its Sell rating on eBay (EBAY -1.8%) ahead of the company’s Q4 earnings report...

    Repeating its Sell rating on eBay (EBAY -1.8%) ahead of the company’s Q4 earnings report due after the close, Deutsche Bank expects results in-line to slightly better than consensus but that “underlying weakness at the company lies ahead in 2012, especially as the U.S. dollar strengthens and comps get tougher in March and beyond... there is growing risk to Street expectations."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 5 Comments
  • IDIX

    Wedbush sets a new price target for Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +4.3%) of $24 on renewed...

    Wedbush sets a new price target for Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +4.3%) of $24 on renewed speculation that a Big Pharma player may take an interest in buying the company. Potential suitors: MRK, JNJ, ABT.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • ODP

    Cost cuts at Office Depot (ODP +3%) and OfficeMax (OMX +8.4%) should help stabilize their...

    Cost cuts at Office Depot (ODP +3%) and OfficeMax (OMX +8.4%) should help stabilize their liquidity amid tight competition, Barclays says in upgrading the stocks to Equal Weight from Underweight. "Recent improvement in small business optimism is encouraging and may have positive implications for companies operating in the office supplies space," the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • BX

    Shares of BancorpSouth (BX -9.3%) slide dramatically following the firm's announcement of a...

    Shares of BancorpSouth (BX -9.3%) slide dramatically following the firm's announcement of a $100M secondary offering. There's no getting around the fact that the sale of shares reps close to 11% of the bank holding company's market cap.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • BHP

    BHP Billiton (BHP +1.5%) says it expects to mine record tonnages of iron ore this year,...

    BHP Billiton (BHP +1.5%) says it expects to mine record tonnages of iron ore this year, shrugging off predictions of slowing industrial activity in China, the largest market for the vast volumes of iron ore, copper, coal and other industrial minerals BHP mines worldwide. Full-year production is forecast to "marginally exceed" prior guidance of 159M metric tons.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • GES

    Piper Jaffray takes it rating on Guess (GES -1.9%) down to Neutral from Overweight to go along...

    Piper Jaffray takes it rating on Guess (GES -1.9%) down to Neutral from Overweight to go along with its $4 price target cut to $29. Wall Street Strategies analyst Brian Sozzi calls the downgrade "odd," given current GES' current valuation and Piper's previous warm feelings for shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • UAA

    Shares of Under Armour (UA -4.8%) move sharply lower after Jefferies trims its estimate for Q4...

    Shares of Under Armour (UA -4.8%) move sharply lower after Jefferies trims its estimate for Q4 EPS to $0.57 - below the consensus mark of $0.63 - due to warm winter weather and rising inventories.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • AABA

    Needham is quite happy with Jerry Yang's departure from Yahoo (YHOO +2.7%), given reports that...

    Needham is quite happy with Jerry Yang's departure from Yahoo (YHOO +2.7%), given reports that Yang was reluctant to sell Yahoo's Asian assets to Alibaba and SoftBank. But Goldman is relatively muted in its enthusiasm; the firm thinks the value of Yahoo's pending deals is already baked into its shares, and that turning Yahoo's core business around will prove a bigger challenge. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • UEPS

    Net1 UEPS Technologies (NASDAQ:UEPS) +26.2% premarket after receiving a contract from the South...

    Net1 UEPS Technologies (NASDAQ:UEPS) +26.2% premarket after receiving a contract from the South African Social Security Agency for the provision of payment services for social grants in all of South Africa's nine provinces. Given the magnitude of the tender award, Net1 says it expects a significant impact on its finances as a result of new volume and pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC Electronic (WFR) +2.8% premarket after issuing downward guidance for Q4 EPS and...

    MEMC Electronic (WFR) +2.8% premarket after issuing downward guidance for Q4 EPS and revenues. CEO Ahmad Chatila: "We responded to the continuing cyclical downturn in the semiconductor industry and the severe market disruption in the solar market by taking decisive action through a significant restructuring."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM

  • Market preview: Higher U.S. stock futures diverge from lower EU shares, with S&P Futures...

    Market preview: Higher U.S. stock futures diverge from lower EU shares, with S&P Futures +0.3% and undimmed by mixed PPI data. Yahoo +3.3% following Jerry Yang's exit, but Target is -2.3% after it ends efforts to sell its credit card receivable portfolio. Bank of New York Mellon -3.4% following its earnings miss. Later: Hearing: Impact of the Volcker Rule, NAHB Housing Market Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
